name: Avoid artifacts with excessive number of parameters (PHP)
description: This rule searches for all the artifacts with excessive number of parameters. Artifacts being checked including methods, functions and constructor. An artifact is considered as having excessive number of parameters if number of parameters are 10 or more.
output:
This report lists all the Artifacts with excessive number of parameters.

This QR provides the following information:
- Artifact full name.
rationale: Long parameter list can indicate that a new object should be created to wrap the numerous parameters. In other words, always try to group the parameters together.
remediation: Review the source code design to reduce the number of parameters.
sample:
<?php
function testData_ten($param1, $param2, $param3, $param4, $param5, $param6, $param7, $param8, $param9, $param10)
 {
 }      
class CastTest
{
 public function __construct($param1, $param2, $param3, $param4, $param5, $param6, $param7, $param8, $param9, $param10)
 {
 }
 public function addData_ten($param1, $param2, $param3, $param4, $param5, $param6, $param7, $param8, $param9, $param10)
 {
 }
}
?>

qualityStandards.name: Callable and Method Control Element Excessive Number of Parameters
qualityStandards.description:
Objective
Avoid over-parameterization

Consequence
Software that does not cap the number of parameters degrades comprehensibility

Measure Element
Number of instances where a named callable control element or method control element has a number of parameters in its signature that exceeds a threshold value. Default threshold value for the number of parameters is 7.
